page.title: 03Agriculture in Canterbury
page.content: {Farming}is pursued up to the very edge of Canterbury, and farms are generally viable and well equipped. They range from holdings of less than 1 hectare to those of several hundred hectares. The SW, S, SE, and East fringes are mostly high quality{soils}intensively used for top fruit and hop growing.The northern margins of the city, in a crescent from Harbledown to Sturry, consists of poorer{land,}and if urban growth has to occur it would be encouraged to the north. There is no typical farming type, but the main{crops}are top and soft fruit together with vegetables.
